description: Learn all about Ayurveda and Homeopathy and what differentiates the two. Find out which treatment mode is more suitable for your issues.
cleaned_text: Contents What is Ayurveda? Having its root back into the Vedic period, Ayurveda was practiced and preached by masters to their students and has since been passed down from generation to generation. It is still alive after a few thousand years. Translating to English, the Sanskrit words Ayurveda means " [The science of life](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ayurveda)". It believes in the age-old saying that is, "prevention is better than cure". Ayurveda and homeopathy are both quite popular alternative treatments these days. Read on to know more about the unique features of both. Ayurveda is prominently based on a natural and holistic approach for our physical and mental being. It dates back to 3000 years ago and follows a [traditional health care methodology](https://trustayur.com/blog/natural-home-remedies/allopathy-vs-ayurveda-5-reasons-to-switch-to-ayurveda/) to lead a healthy lifestyle. Its treatment mainly involves introducing plant-based products into ur diet, some exercise, and a blanched lifestyle. It has an ancient origin and is developed on various prehistoric scriptures and writings. Maintaining a balance between consciousness, mind, and body to prevent diseases is the gist of what Ayurveda promotes. Although this process would be highly personalized for every individual focusing on their inner make-up. As long as this balance is maintained, the individual is healthy. But, as soon as there is a disruption of this balance due to external or internal factors the body is bound to fall prey to diseases. [Restoring this balance](https://trustayur.com/blog/natural-home-remedies/allopathy-vs-ayurveda-5-reasons-to-switch-to-ayurveda/) to cure a disease or medical problem is what Ayurveda promotes. What Are The Three Doshas In Ayurveda? According to Ayurveda, there are three different types of energies namely [Vatta, Pitta, and Kapha](https://trustayur.com/blog/ayurvedic-body-types/) which are collectively called doshas. Pitta constitutes of digestions and metabolism of the body, while Vatta represents activity and movement and Kapha represents lubrication and bones. Imbalance in any of these would lead to problems and diseases. Making changes and amendments in our lifestyle and eating habits is the cure to an imbalance in doshas and the path to good health. What is Homeopathy? Developed by a German physician Samuel Hahnemann, Homeopathy is a system of alternative medicine. Homeopathy means "similar suffering" in a very literal sense. In homeopathy, the treatment is based on triggering our [body's immune system](https://trustayur.com/blog/natural-home-remedies/natural-home-remedies-to-boost-immunity/) to fight against any disease. The principle here is that any substance that results in illness in a healthy person, can be administered in a dilute portion to heal people showing the same symptoms. Basic Principles Of Homeopathy It is laid on three basic principles- like cures like minimum dose and single remedy. Based on the principle that a substance when administered in a healthy person in dilute proportions that results in symptoms can heal people showing similar symptoms. 'Like cures like', minimal dose, and single remedy are a few of the guiding principles of homeopathy. Focused on the entirety of the body instead of just the affected part homeopathy basically aims to restore the physical, mental and emotional state of the patients. Hence, it is very beneficial for the healing process To learn more about this: [Read Ayurveda vs Homeopathy](https://trustayur.com/blog/ayurveda-lifestyle/difference-between-homeopathy-and-ayurveda/) Homeopathy and Ayurveda Together It is not exactly recommended to try both Ayurveda and homeopathy at the same time. Sure a few of the principles in both Ayurveda and homeopathy might coincide. However, the problem arises when any aggravation you notice or experience would be difficult to pinpoint caused by which prescription and further lead to difficult case management. Therefore, when using homeopathy one should forgo any medicinal herbs. Similarly, while using Ayurveda try not to use anything other than what is prescribed because intersection in any of the treatments might lead to fatal results. Whatever it is that you want to try or prefer using do not forget to [consult with an ayurvedic practitioner](https://trustayur.com/) or a doctor. Matters of health should be treated with precaution and proper care.
